Literature Review: Approximate methods for Bayesian computation have emerged as a response to the challenges posed by big data and complex models in Bayesian analysis. The traditional Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) algorithms, which have seen significant development over the last 30 years, are often computationally expensive and may not be able to handle large datasets efficiently. In this review, we discuss modern algorithmic developments that address these challenges and compare their performance using numerical experiments.
